quizzes.title: History Quiz: Opel and Cars
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, manufacture, beamer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Which of these important events in the history of Opel happened in 1924?

options.text: Opel installed Germanys first car production line.
The company was destroyed by a fire.
Opel opened its first factory outside Germany.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Opel installed Germanys first car production line.

questions.question: This German car brand, founded in 1919, is nicknamed Beamer in English.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: BMW

questions.question: Where did Opel open a factory in 1982 for production of the Opel Corsa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zaragoza, Spain

questions.question: This Italian manufacturer of sports cars was founded in 1929, and in 1947 it started producing street-legal vehicles.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ferrari

questions.question: What company bought Opel in 1931?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General Motors

questions.question: This Japanese car brand is among the largest automobile producers on the planet. It was founded in 1909 under a slightly different name.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Suzuki

questions.question: Which of these is the name under which Opel designs are sold in the UK?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vauxhall

questions.question: What was the name of the light trucks the Opel company began making in 1930?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blitz

questions.question: The Opel company was founded in 1863 and began making cars in 1899. What was the first name of its founder Opel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Adam

questions.question: Opel first showed cars of their own design in 1902 at this motor show in Germany.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hamburg Motor Show

questions.question: Soon after WWII, this Opel model was transferred to the Soviet Union and formed the basis for the Soviet car Moskvitch 400/420.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kadett

questions.question: This French car manufacturer also produces vans, buses, tractors, and trucks. The brand was established in 1899.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these

questions.question: What was the original logo of Opel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a zeppelin

questions.question: What did Opel manufacture before it began making cars in 1899?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: sewing machines and bicycles

questions.question: This British car manufacturer produces high performance vehicles. The company was founded in 1989.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: McLaren

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Grey Gardens and Documentary
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, horch, village. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What Italian car make was established on July 11, 1899 in Turin, Italy by Giovanni Agnelli?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fiat

questions.question: The village of East Hampton was shocked upon learning that the two eccentric occupants of the dilapidated Grey Gardens estate were harboring not only cats, but what unusual animals in their attic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Raccoons

questions.question: What was the name of the street on which the Grey Gardens estate was located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lily Pond Lane

questions.question: At what New York nightclub did American socialite Little Edie have a cabaret act for about two weeks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reno Sweeny

questions.question: This French car make was the first outside of the USA to produce automobiles for mass usage.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Citroen

questions.question: The film Grey Gardens premiered at what New York theater?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Paris

questions.question: What were the names of the two eccentric women who lived at the estate known as Grey Gardens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edith and Edie Beale

questions.question: In the documentary Grey Gardens, Edie shows a photograph of her younger days as a model and says that it hung in a very unusual place. Where?

options.text: At the perfume counter in Tiffanys
In the ladies room at Sax Fifth Avenue
In the front window of Lord and Taylor

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In the elevator at Macys

questions.question: This U.S. automobile brand produces off-road vehicles, and was established in 1992.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hummer

questions.question: What first lady was the famous cousin of the daughter living at Grey Gardens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jacqueline Kennedy

questions.question: What was the name of the friend and neighbor featured in the documentary Grey Gardens who was an accomplished artist and known as the palmist of East Hampton?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lois Wright

questions.question: This Japanese car make was established in 1970, but the first automobile of the brand was released in 1917.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mitsubishi

questions.question: What were the first names of the brothers who directed the documentary about Grey Gardens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Albert and David

questions.question: Which cat was not referenced in the documentary Grey Gardens by either of the women?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Snowflake

questions.question: This German car brand was founded by August Horch in 1909.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Audi

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Gold and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, condition, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the color of pure gold, which it maintains without oxidizing in air and water?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bright yellow

questions.question: Which of these countries is a major producer of gold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Sound travels more swiftly through air than through steel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about the properties of gold?

options.text: It is unaffected by air and moisture

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is unaffected by air and moisture

questions.question: What internal organs are some gold salts, such as potassium gold cyanide, toxic for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kidneys and liver

questions.question: This US states name means People of the south wind. The buffalo and the honeybee are just two of its symbols. It is located equidistant from the Pacific and the Atlantic Ocean. Susanna Salter (the first woman mayor in the US) was elected mayor of a city in this state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kansas

questions.question: In the treatment of what serious disease is the isotope gold-198 used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cancer

questions.question: For what medical condition is non-metallic gold beneficial, according to some studies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which of these facts refers to gold in its metallic form?

options.text: It is the most malleable of all metals
It is not a good conductor of electricity
I is a good insulator of heat

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It is the most malleable of all metals

questions.question: The fastest growing nail is on this finger.

options.text: All nails grow at the same speed

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Middle finger

questions.question: What country is the largest consumer of gold in the world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: India

questions.question: George Washington, Thomas Jefferson, and John Adams were all avid players of this game.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marbles

questions.question: In this country one out of ten people owns a bicycle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denmark

questions.question: In which of these everyday activities and industrial areas is gold sometimes used?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: In what form is gold added to some expensive dishes, especially sweets and drinks?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Animals and Michigan
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, average, michigan. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Neil Armstrong stepped on the moon with his right foot on first.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In order to preserve their elaborate coiffures, these women slept with their heads on bags filled with buckwheat chaff.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Geishas in Japan

questions.question: The first product to have a bar code was this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gum

questions.question: This group was formed in Detroit, Michigan and its original members were Otis Williams, Melvin Franklin, Paul Williams, Elbridge Al Bryant, and Eddie Kendricks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Temptations

questions.question: Ernest Vincent Wright wrote a book, called Gadsby, which consisted of 50,000 words, none of which contained this letter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: E

questions.question: The third largest landowner in New York City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York University

questions.question: Ailurophobia is fear of these animals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cats

questions.question: This talk show host and entertainer began his career as a member of Freddy Martins orchestra, but became popular with nightclub audiences as a solo act. His song, Ive Got a Lovely Bunch of Coconuts became a number one hit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Merv Griffin

questions.question: Finish the proverb:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ...not made.

questions.question: Benito Mussolini, Napoleon Bonaparte, Alexander the Great, and Julius Caesar were all afraid of these animals.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cats

questions.question: By US law, employees do not have to wash hands after sneezing.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The term hippopotomonstrosesquippedaliophobia means abnormal fear of what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Long words

questions.question: In parts of Japan, if a black cat crosses your path, it means you will be very lucky.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: On average, a 4-year-old child asks approximately this number of questions a day.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 437

questions.question: All US Presidents have worn glasses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Actor and Town
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, actor, director. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The town of Pilsen, famous for the production of beer, is situated in western Bohemia, in the Czech Republic. It became a town in 1295 when it received its civic charter from which ruler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Wenceslaus II

questions.question: Doctor Dolittle is the central character of a series of childrens books by this author.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hugh Lofting

questions.question: This actor, who graduated from Yale University in 1991, received a Golden Globe for his role in 1996 movie Primal Fear.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Edward Norton

questions.question: This US city, whose original name was Terminus, is the county seat of Fulton County.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Atlanta

questions.question: This actor and director, who took the name Broncho Billy, is best-known as the first star of the Western film genre.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Max H. Aronson

questions.question: If you wish to surrender, you will do one of these white things.

options.text: You will drive a white car.
You will visit the White House.
You will raise a white flag.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: You will raise a white flag.

questions.question: New York Alki was a settlement which became part of which US city?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Seattle

questions.question: The author of the White Fang is Jack London.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: One of the most important buildings in the US - the White House, was gutted in this year.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1814

questions.question: What is the meaning of the word albedo, which comes from Latin?

options.text: A bright region on the suns chromosphere
A value for the reflectivity of an object
A disease afflicting canines in which the fur around the tail falls out
An adjustment to a projectiles flight using retro-rockets

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A value for the reflectivity of an object

questions.question: The album Whitesnake 1987 by Whitesnake included three of these songs. Which is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fool For Your Loving

questions.question: The white pages are a telephone directory listing of the telephone numbers of these entities.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ordinary subscribers

questions.question: In L.A. Dragnet, which is a 2003 remake of the TV series Dragnet, detective Joe Friday was portrayed by which actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ed ONeil

questions.question: There is hardly any one who has not heard the fairy-tale of Snow White. Who was it written by?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brothers Grimm

questions.question: This actor starred in the Hollywood production White Noise (2005).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Michael Keaton

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Character and Novel
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, cartoon, calvin. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Of which major city was Tammany Hall the leading political power brokers?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

questions.question: Dr. Ross Geller from the TV show Friends teaches paleontology at this university in New York City.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York University

questions.question: The Strange Case of Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde is a novella written by this person.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Louis Stevenson

questions.question: Which is the only UN member not allowed to be on the Security Council?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Israel

questions.question: Frankenstein is the name of a doctor from a famous novel by Mary Shelley.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Dr. Quinn, Medicine Woman works in this town.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Colorado Springs

questions.question: Approximately how long does it take a fingernail to grow from the base to the tip?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6 months

questions.question: The sewing machine was invented in a dream.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Approximately how fast can a sneeze travel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 100 miles per hour

questions.question: Doctor Zhivago is a character from a novel of the same name by Boris Pasternak. This is the historical background of the story in the book.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russian Revolution

questions.question: Dr. Susan Calvin, the main character of many short stories, is a robopsychologist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What does an average single fetus acquire at the age of three months?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: fingerprints

questions.question: Dr. Watson is the sidekick of Sherlock Holmes. Do you know his first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John

questions.question: What was Bachs reason in writing the Etudes?

options.text: Earn money  - they were sold as study  pieces
Show that the harpsichord was inferior to the piano
Show that he could compose easy pieces, thereby promoting a large number of students to his study

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Keep his children occupied

questions.question: Who drew the first pollitical cartoon published in an American newspaper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ben Franklin
